tooltip.malumarma.no_runes:
No socketed runes... 
Right Click in your inventory with a rune to socket one
tooltip.malumarma.volatile_distortion.de: +15% chance on hit to 'Volatile Crit' & trigger a random rune category
tooltip.malumarma.culling.description: Fully-charged attacks add a delayed magic strike & trigger offensive runes
tooltip.malumarma.dexterity.description: Increase speed by +20% for 3s on crit
tooltip.malumarma.howling_gale.descripti: Grants Howling Gale while held, Doesn't stack
tooltip.malumarma.flowing_grasp.descript: Grants Flowing Grasp while held, Doesn't stack
tooltip.malumarma.stone_ward.description: Grants Stone Ward while held, Doesn't stack
tooltip.malumarma.burning_fervor.descrip: Grants Burning Fervor while held, Doesn't stack
tooltip.malumarma.sky_tether.description: Grants Sky Tether while held, Doesn't stack
tooltip.malumarma.good_tides.description: Grants Good Tides while held, Doesn't stack
tooltip.malumarma.oaken_might.descriptio: Grants Oaken Might while held, Doesn't stack
tooltip.malumarma.fiery_embrace.descript: Grants Fiery Embrace while held, Doesn't stack
tooltip.malumarma.heresy.description: Add +1 level of Silenced for 2s on hit
tooltip.malumarma.unnatural_stamina.desc: Damage & knockback increase while sprinting + bonus depending on speed attribute
tooltip.malumarma.twinned_duration.descr: Extends positive effects by +2s on crit
tooltip.malumarma.igneous_solace.descrip: Reduce damage by -2 if attacker is on fire while held
tooltip.malumarma.mana_redirection.descr: [Ability] Consume half of your soul ward, Release up to 4 Arcane Bolts per 2 soul ward consumed
tooltip.malumarma.mana_redirection.detri: [Ability] Consume all of your soul ward, Release 2 Arcane Bolts per 2 soul ward consumed
tooltip.malumarma.spatial_carving.descri: [Ability] Passively reduce your physical damage, Slashstep forwards
tooltip.malumarma.spatial_carving.detrim: [Ability] Insignificant physical damage, Slashstep further with 2x magic damage
tooltip.malumarma.soul_gashing.descripti: [Ability] Non-lethally consume health equal to half your max HP, Inflict Soul Gash on your next hit equal to health used
tooltip.malumarma.soul_gashing.detriment: [Ability] Consume health equal to half your max HP, Inflict Soul Gash equal to double your health used, Vastly enhanced if lethal
tooltip.malumarma.detrimental_empowermen: [Passive] Detrimentally empower your Arma Runes, worsening their downsides and enhancing their abilities

death.attack.soul_gash_death: %1$s gave their all, which wasn't enough.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.runicallo: Soul Stained Steel, while an excellent material, is rather poor at the actual conduction of arcana, Its ability to strike the soul is wonderful, but it leaves much to be desired in the field of imbuement or channeling.

Thus, the process of creating a more reliably suitable alloy for such weaponry began. Mystically alloying copper and iron is good, but neither a feat nor good for weaponry. Hallowed gold, though, could allow far greater conduction of arcana.

Using it, I have created a versatile alloy which I have dubbed Runic Alloy. While its durability and resilience leaves much to be desired, it is an excellent conductor of arcana, and, by lining the edges of blades with it, it can redirect the magic of a rune to its victim or myself in ways different to a brooch.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.void.runi:
(Developer Note): Accursed Alloy is a planned material, which I'll be adding in a future Arma update. 
Its weapons will focus around stacking an effect named Malice on yourself 
to deal massive damage when consuming your stacks
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.armarunes:
While the previous runes I have created are excellent for use in Runic Weaponry, few have any substantially deadly effects. They are made for different purposes after all. 
Still, there is no harm in experimenting with the alloy I have created, and so I thought to use it as a base for a rune.

By doing so, and with some changes to my inscribing methods, I have created what I call Arma Runes. These runes draw their power from some aspect of either the weapon or myself, and use that drawn power to perform their respective ability. 
 To note is the fact that they seem to resist being put next to each other, meaning only one can fit in a runic weapon no matter how hard I try.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.runic_wea:
Favoring magical force, the Sword is an agile, dependable design. 
Its socket has a capacity of two runes.

Favoring physical force, the Hatchet is as most axes are, hard hitting if not a bit sluggish. 
Its socket has a capacity of two runes.

Favoring greater magical force, the Greatsword hits harder than its smaller counterpart, at the cost of less agility in comparison. 
Its socket has a capacity of four runes.

Favoring greater physical force, the Greataxe's size and weight gives it far more force than its smaller counterpart, at the cost of being even more sluggish. 
Its socket has a capacity of three runes.
Favoring neither magical nor physical forces, the Glaive is an outlier, While on its own it leaves much to be desired, it makes up for this with a socket capacity of five runes.
When socketing a Rune of Vitality into a Runic Weapon, hitting a target with enough force mends wounds, albeit only slightly.
When socketing a Rune of Culling into a Runic Weapon, hitting a target causes wicked energy to build within them, leading to a burst of harmful magic after a short time.
When socketing a Rune of Reinforcement into a Runic Weapon, hitting a target redirects a small fragment of the scattered magic through the handle, mending Soul Ward.

When socketing a Rune of Volatile Distortion into a Runic Weapon, hitting a target has a chance to strike with more force than usual. 
Additionally, it causes other runes, either beneficial or offensive, to activate on their own.
When socketing a Rune of Dexterity into a Runic Weapon, hitting a target with enough force channels the magic from within the rune to hasten its wielder for a short time.
When socketing a Rune of Ailment Cleansing into a Runic Weapon, hitting a target with enough force channels the magic from within the rune to aid in cleansing negative effects.
When socketing a Rune of Protection into a Runic Weapon, the weapon channels the magic within the rune to reinforce the wielder's armor.
When socketing a Rune of Scorching into a Runic Weapon, hitting a target channels magic within the rune through the blade and into the victim, igniting them or bolstering an existing flame.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.void.sock: When socketing a Rune of Bolstering into a Runic Weapon, the weapon channels the magic within the rune to force the body to heal past its limits, granting extra health.

When socketing a Rune of Radial Empowerment into a Runic Weapon, the weapon channels the magic within the rune to grant a small extension to the blade's reach. 
This effect does not seem to improve as well as the others when more are added.
When socketing a Rune of Spell Mastery into a Runic Weapon, hitting a target with enough force redirects scattered magic into staves, charging them.
When socketing a Rune of Heresy into a Runic Weapon, hitting a target channels the magic within the rune through the blade and into the victim, silencing them.
When socketing a Rune of Unnatural Stamina into a Runic Weapon, hitting a target amplifies the impact using the wielder's speed, granting an increase in damage.
When socketing a Rune of Twinned Duration into a Runic Weapon, hitting a target with enough force channels the magic from within the rune to extend positive effects by a short duration.
When socketing a Rune of Indomitability into a Runic Weapon, the weapon channels the magic within the rune to anchor its wielder to the ground, reducing knockback.
When socketing a Rune of Igneous Solace into a Runic Weapon, the weapon channels the magic within the rune to grant a barrier against targets that are ablaze.
malum.gui.book.entry.void.mana_redirecti: Sapped barriers to seek and destroy
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.mana_redi: Drawing its power from Soul Ward, Mana Redirection channels and directs arcana through the blade, forming seeking bolts of arcane energy depending on how much goes through it.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.void.mana:
When paired with Detrimental Empowerment, Mana Redirection, similar to Soul Gashing, loses its limit on how much soul ward it can draw power from and takes as much as it possibly can. 
 This also results in seemingly no limit on how many bolts can be formed.
malum.gui.book.entry.void.spatial_carvin: Dulled blades to split in two
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.spatial_c: Drawing its power from blade sharpness, Spatial Carving gathers arcana on the edge of the blade, momentarily creating an impossibly sharp edge capable of cutting through space itself at the cost of withering the existing edge.
Note: Caution should be advised with the direction one chooses to carve in, as you may end up stuck in terrain, or worse, suffocating in it.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.void.spat: When paired with Detrimental Empowerment, Spatial Carving withers the blade at a far greater, far more powerful rate. This increase in speed and severity causes the rune itself to hold more magic than before, which allows longer periods of carving.
While the nature of an Arma Rune is to hurt, the nature of Sacred is to heal. These two desires clash within the rune, and since one is never able to overcome the other, the rune simply does nothing.
I am curious as to what would result from one overpowering the other, though I see no way to achieve this without the rune becoming too large to fit in my current arsenal.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.soul_gash: Drawing its power from pain, Soul Gashing forms vicious serrations of arcana on the blade, These serrations inflict grave wounds upon the soul of the victim, causing them to, in simple terms, bleed from their very soul.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.void.soul:
When paired with Detrimental Empowerment, Soul Gashing gains far more power from pain, but also no longer stops at death. In fact, it appears to withhold death itself for but a moment, perhaps to prolong the suffering of its user? 
 That is a very unpleasant thought.
I'm grateful to have had a totem of undying on hand while testing this.
malum.gui.book.entry.void.detrimental_em: To have it all and yearn for more
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.void.detr: While experimenting with what was and wasn't transformed by the well, I had to clear my pack of some needless clutter, Within it was a Rune of Opposing, which I simply threw away, It slid across the well's edge and fell in, and after that...

It changed! Much to my surprise, as Runic Alloy was simply spat out when I threw it in. 
 It feels heavier than before and the etching has grown, It also seems to have gained what I can only describe as a heartbeat, and when moving it into my pack, I noticed it was not pushed away from the socket of my glaive unlike other Arma Runes.

After I arrived back to my lab, I tried socketing the rune into a Runic Alloy Sword with Spatial Carving already in it, and, as I somewhat expected, it went in with no hassle. 
 
 The rune appears to empower the Arma Rune paired with it at the cost of making said rune thirst for far more.
